description: These smoky tempeh and black bean burgers are simple to whip up and make a great meat-free dinner option.
name: Tempeh & Black Bean Burgers Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 4 cloves garlic, peeled and minced, divided
2 small red onion, peeled and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Heat half the oil in a large pan on medium high and add the red onion and garlic cook for 2 minutes, stirring often. Add the carrots, cumin, smoked paprika and soy sauce and cook for 5-6 minutes to soften.

Tip the mixture into a food processor and add the black beans, ground almonds, almond butter and tomato paste. Pulse for 20 seconds to form a coarse mix. Add the tempeh and pulse for 10 seconds or until just mixed through.

Shape into 6 patties using your hands and place in the fridge for 45 minutes to firm up. Heat the remaining oil in a pan on medium high heat and cook for 3 minutes on each side, until browned and cooked through.
Toast the wholemeal rolls, add the burgers and top with guacamole and salad to serve.
